job_details.degree_required: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university

jd: From: Avinash Kumar, ZealHire Inc avinash@zealhire.com Reply to: avinash@zealhire.com Position: Program/Project Manager (This is a Business PM role not Technical PM-- need someone who has handled business and infrastructure projects)Location: Frisco, TX & Auburn Hills, MI - Hybrid Duration: Long-Term ContractVisa Status: Only USC/GCDesired Years of experience:- 10+ Years Job Description: USC/GCneed LinkedIn, VISA DLNeed skills matrix and the questionnaire along with submission resume must be under 5 pages Local to TX/MI This is a Buisness PM role not Technical PM-- need someone who has handled business and infrastructure projects MUST HAVE SKILLSProgram ManagerSupporting Business ProjectsPartnering with Business Stakeholders (Stakeholder Management)Issue Management (RAID LogsNEED THE QUESTIONAIRE ALONG WITH THE SUBMITTALHow many years of experience do you have with:Project Management-IT Projects-Have you supported IT Application Development projects?Yes: Can you provide high level details for the application projects (technologies, conversion/ upgrade/ implementation)?What methodologies have you followed on IT projects?Waterfall: What project documentation were you responsible on Waterfall projects?Agile: What was your role with sprint management?Have you supported banking/finance projects/clients?Yes: Which companies did you support?Yes: Did you support banking regulations (include REG names)?Walk me through the steps you were responsible for to kick off a project.What were your responsibilities with creating or maintaining project charters?How many projects/programs have you managed simultaneously?What is the highest number of stakeholders you’ve worked with on a project?From end to end on the project, tell me your responsibilities with the project financials.Provide brief examples of how you managed/supported:Risk Management:Creating Risk Analysis plan:RAID logs: We're looking for seasoned PROGRAM/project managers that can drive results through proven project management methods, stakeholder management, effective communication, and issue management. Finance industry and compliance and regulatory knowledge are preferred.Program ManagerComerica is looking for a seasoned Program Manager to help us with an enterprise wide project to simplify processes throughout the organization. The Program Manager will be responsible for delivery of enterprise programs, program management methodologies/processes, tools and metrics around this simplification initiative.This role will also provide expert leadership, instruction, and direction to all team members as they complete their responsibilities, as well as regularly communicates with executive leadership. This position is a great way to obtain broad exposure and learnings throughout the entire organization.Position ResponsibilitiesProject Execution/Risk ManagementProvide expert leadership and oversight to address highly complex, high profile issues and reduce impact of events adverse to the project.Provide awareness on the connection points for the delivery and execution of aligned projects.Provide appropriate communication for integration effort that may require adjustment to products planned for each project.Manage conflicting projects, environments, and team and recommend appropriate sequencing/mitigation plan.Act as liaison between internal projects and technology teams as well as external partners and business partners.Manage budget programs and bring successful completion on time, on budget and to customer satisfaction delivering project business benefits.Provide expert management of risk management plans to decrease the probability, complex multi-function delivery relationships with executive leadership, establish relationships of trust with management and colleagues; and driving consensus across the organization on difficult topics.Manage vendor relationships, contract negotiation and reconcilement of vendor invoices and hold vendor accountable to cost/schedule/quality deliverables.Effectively manage vendor code release management.Interact with executive leadership (Vice Chairman, CIO, CTO, SVP and EVP) on a regular basis for program status communication, financial updates, and project sponsor mentoring of their roles/responsibilities.Resource PlanningSelect contractor resources for projects and lead contractor project management staff.Mentor project team members and provide a role model for individual development.Identify areas of development in project team members and communicate performance improvements and coach towards improvement.Mentor and encourage skill development of project team members.Provide performance review feedback and development recommendations for project team members to their managers.Manage and lead transformation and diversity initiatives.Financial ManagementManage to the financial budget and schedule established for the program.Employ expert financial acumen with proper financial forecasting and create financial reports for executive leadership communication.Review and approve the program budget updates and maintenance.Business Project Manager Responsible for all aspects of the development and implementation of assigned projects and provides a single point of contact for those projects. Provides business and analytical guidance to project team. Recommends and takes action to direct the analysis and solutions of problems. Complete management of all aspects of the project management methodology especially Scope, Time, and Cost triple constraint.Position ResponsibilitiesProject Planning and ExecutionManages large projects of high complexity.Responsible for on-time delivery and execution of critical Technology projects and initiatives to deliver business value.Works with core project team (such as business partners, vendors, and technical team) to develop detailed, actionable project schedules. Assigns tasks to team and develops detailed and accurate work schedules, project estimates, and resource plans.Executes, monitors, and controls projects from original concept throughfinal Delivery.Communicates accurate and timely project accomplishments and overall project health to stakeholders via required measures and methods (such as status reports, metrics, checkpoints, portfolio reports, and scorecards).Manages and monitors project budgets as required based on project needs. Ensures cost changes have accurate and timely approvals and follow corporate and department standards, policies, and procedures.Reviews project deliverables.Manages vendor team(s) as applicable and required, and tracks and reviews vendor deliverables.Ensures support areas are engaged to drive effective training and turnover of project deliverables.Risk ManagementEnsures adherence to all government, corporate and department standards,policies and procedures in all project deliverables, artifacts, tasks, and decisions across the team.Works to ensure all artifacts adhere to all standards, policies, and procedures.Proactively manages project risks and risk mitigation plans.Position QualificationsBachelor's Degree from an accredited university5 years of experience working in a team setting to deliver projects5 years of project management experience including managing large projects with cross functional teams5 years of gathering requirements and preparing documentation5 years of analyzing data and providing recommendations5 years of project management and resource planning tools building and executing actionable plans5 years of effectively executing concurrent projects of varying size, cost, technologies, complexity, and riskTechnologies- MS Project, JIRA (used by IT), Excel
